column2: She was very good and sweet, in spite of her one foolish, bitter mistake, and I want to be as much like her as I can.
column3: She was very good and sweet, in spite of her one foolish, bitter mistake, and I want to be as much like her as I can.

column2: I said that this was _almost_ the dearest and most beautiful thing. The very dearest and most beautiful is this--God means something to me now. column3: false

column2: He means so much!
column3: He means so much!

column2: I remember that you said to me that he meant nothing to me because I had no human love in my heart to translate the divine.
column3: I remember that you said to me that he meant nothing to me because I had no human love in my heart to translate the divine.

column2: But I have now, and it has led me to Him.
column3: But I have now, and it has led me to Him.

column2: I am not going back to Taunton.	I am not going back to Taunton.
column3: true

column2: I have sent in my resignation.
column3: I have sent in my resignation.

column2: I am going to stay home with Aunty and Uncle.
column3: I am going to stay home with Aunty and Uncle.

column2: It is so sweet to say _home_ and know what it means.
column3: It is so sweet to say underscore home underscore and know what it means.

column2: Aunty says you must come and spend all your next vacation with us. You see, I have lots of vacation plans now, even for a year ahead. After all, there is no need of the blue pills! column2: I feel like a new creature, made over from the heart and soul out.	I feel like a new creature, made over from the heart and soul out.

column2: I look back with shame and contrition on the old Constance.
column3: I look back with shame and contrition on the old Constance.

column2: I want you to forget her and only remember your grateful friend, the _new_ Constance."
